ch.aplu.ev3

Class HTEopdShortSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.ev3.Part
      • ch.aplu.ev3.Sensor
        • ch.aplu.ev3.HTEopdShortSensor

  • public class HTEopdShortSensor
extends Sensor
    Class that represents an Electro-Optical Proximity Detector (HiTechnic EDPD). The sensor measures distance uniformly colored objects in range of about 15 cm. It is much less effected by ambient light than a standard color or light sensor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTEopdShortSensor()
      Creates a sensor instance connected to port S1 in short distance mode.
      HTEopdShortSensor(SensorPort port)
      Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port in short distance mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTEopdShortSensor

        public HTEopdShortSensor(SensorPort port)
        Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port in short distance mode. The short distance mode is used to detect white objects at close distance.
        Parameters:
        port - the port where the sensor is plugged-in

      • HTEopdShortSensor

        public HTEopdShortSensor()
        Creates a sensor instance connected to port S1 in short distance mode. The short distance mode is used to detect white objects at close distance.

    • Method Detail

      • getLejosSensor

        public lejos.hardware.sensor.HiTechnicEOPD getLejosSensor()
        Returns the reference of the the underlying lejos.hardware.sensor.HiTechnicEOPD.
        Returns:
        the reference of the lejos.hardware.sensor.EV3ColorSensor

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Polls the sensor.
        Returns:
        the current value the sensor reported in arbitrary units from 0..999 (999 if the sensor does not detect a target)
